subject: RE: [junit] Testing with different of data
msgSnippet: There s a tool called Enhanced Junit (http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit) that provides a simple API for iterating over and parsing simple,
messageBody:
There's a tool called Enhanced Junit
(http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit) that provides a
simple API for iterating over and parsing simple, character delimited
text files. Here's an example:

public void testSomethingWithData() {
DelimitedFileReader reader =
new DelimitedFileReader(
"file:///c:/testdata.dat", // URL String for data file
",", // Delimiter
true, // 1st record has variable names
true); // 2nd record has variable types

// Read all rows from delimited text file.
// Records are parsed and provided as Hashtable
while (reader.hasMoreElements()) {
Hashtable data = (Hashtable) reader.nextElement();
// Do something with next row of values in data here
testSomething(
data.get("accountNumber").intValue(),
data.get("name"),
data.get("type").charValue(),
data.get("balance").floatValue());
}
}

public void testSomething(int accountNumber, String name, char type,
float balance) {
// Create and test object under test given passed test values
}


The above will iterate over a comma-delimited text file that looks like
this (it looks better viewed in a spreadsheet):
accountNumber,name,type,balance
int,String,char,float
1111,Thurston Howell III,c,99999999.0
5555,Professor Roy Hinkley,s,35000.0
0000,Willie Gilligan,c,0.56

For each line it will pull out all the values and store them in a
Hashtable, keyed by the respective column name in the first line, cast
to the type indicated in the 2nd line and wrapped as an object. Once
they are in Hashtable form you can do what you want with them. In this
case it calls a parameterized method testSomething(int accountNumber,
String name, char type, float balance) that presumably holds the actual
test logic.


-----------------------------
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The Object Testing Company
www.javatesting.com

> chasstw wrote:
>
> > How I can test a method with diferent set of data ?. Does
> it possible
> > to test it in one execution time ? It's must be very
> simple, but I'm a
> > newbie.
>
> It's not simple. You want a Parameterized Test Case. I
> suggest searching
> the archives of this list for the phrase "Parameterized Test Case". A
> few descriptions will be in there.
